section.title: AI Service Configuration Preferences
section.p: Various service-related connection settings can be configured in Options Preferences Plugins Oxygen AI Positron AI Service Configuration . This preferences page is divided into two sections. The top Connections section is for those who want to use an AI service provider of their choice while the bottom AI Positron Service section is for those who want to use the built-in default service.

The connections table allows you to configure connections to various AI service providers. Click the New button under the table to configure a new connection or the Edit button to edit an existing connection. You can also use Delete to remove a connection or Move Up/Move Down to move a selected connection.
When adding or editing a connection, the resulting configuration dialog box contains the following options:

dlentry.dd: Specifies the name of the connection.
Displays the automatically generated ID for the connection.

Specifies the connector type. The default options are: OpenAI, Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Anthropic Claude, AWS Bedrock, Google Gemini, or xAI Grok. Additional add-ons are also available to enable connections to the Google Cloud's Vertex AI platform or a custom AI service.
The remaining options depend on the chosen Connector type. The the details for each type below.

p.note: You can use editor variables such as ${env(ENV_NAME)} in all configuration and header parameter values.

dlentry.dd:
If OpenAI is chosen as the connector type, the Connection details section contains the following settings:
Enable speech-to-text This setting allows for speech-to-prompt transcribing using the AI engine. If enabled, the Start recording prompt using the microphone button should be displayed under the chat box (in the AI Positron view).
You can use your own fine-tuned OpenAI models.
The OpenAI connector might work with other AI engines that use the OpenAI APIs (like Grok or Deepseek).

If Microsoft Azure OpenAI is chosen as the connector type, the Connection details section contains the following settings:
API key
The Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service key necessary to work with the connector.
If an API key is not provided, the application will attempt to authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID by using one of the supported identity-based methods.
Speech service region If a speech service is configured in the MS Azure account, you can use this setting to set the region of the server (for example: eastus). As an alternative, you can set a SPEECH_REGION environmental variable. Once the speech service is configured, the Start recording prompt using the microphone button should be displayed under the chat box (in the AI Positron view). This button allows for speech-to-prompt transcribing using the AI engine.
Speech service key If a speech service is configured in the MS Azure account, you can use this setting to set the key to be used with the service. As an alternative, you can set a SPEECH_KEY environmental variable.
You can use your own fine-tuned Microsoft Azure OpenAI models.

If AWS Bedrock is chosen as the connector type, the Connection details section contains the following settings:
AWS Region The AWS region of the server (e.g. us-east-1). When you specify the region, the Base URL field is populated automatically.
Base URL The web address where the connector service is located. When specifying the AWS Region, this field is automatically populated. When both the AWS Region and Base URL are specified, AI Positron includes the region in the URL.
AWS Bedrock API key The API key required for authenticating. For information about generating the API key, see Amazon Bedrock Documentation: Generate API Keys.
Default model The default model to be used for the chat view and for actions that do not explicitly specify a model. For a list of supported models in AWS Bedrock, see Amazon Bedrock Documentation: Supported Foundation Models.

section.p: This section contains the following options for using the default AI Positron Service:

dlentry.dt: Enable connections to the AI Positron Service
dlentry.dd: If selected, the AI Positron add-on is allowed to access the AI Positron Service platform. If not selected, the AI Positron add-on is prohibited from connecting and using models from the AI Positron Service platform.
Displays the address of the service connection. Currently, there is only one public platform that provides this service.

The default model is used for the chat pane and for actions that do not explicitly specify a fixed model. Each chosen model consumes a certain number of credits per token. The gpt-4.1 model is used by default if no other model is chosen.

section.title: Actions Preferences
section.p: Various settings related to AI actions can be configured in Options Preferences Plugins Oxygen AI Positron Actions :

dlentry.dd: Specifies if default actions are loaded.
You can use this option to specify a local folder where you have stored additional actions.

You can specify a comma-separated list of IDs for the actions that you do not want presented in the list of available actions. Use the menu to the right of the text field to choose the actions to exclude.

dlentry.dt: Embed AI Positron in Author page
dlentry.dd: Controls whether or not the AI Positron drop-down widget is displayed when documents are open in the Author visual editing mode. This drop-down list contains some of the most useful AI actions for creating and improving the structure and content of the current document.

dlentry.dt: Show actions as buttons in Chat view
dlentry.dd: If selected, the AI actions are displayed in the main chat pane in addition to the other UI locations where the actions are presented.

p.note: Custom actions are loaded and shown first in the UI locations where the actions are presented.

dlentry.dd: A setting used to disable the user-specific memory store that contains rules stored by the AI engine for the current user. It is enabled by default.

A text area that contains the set of rules stored by the AI engine for the current user. The text area is fully editable. All the rules from this text area are gathered and used along with the Context when any AI action is invoked or when chatting with the AI engine.

dlentry.dt: Enable AI Autocompletion in Text page
dlentry.dd: Enables context-aware code snippet suggestions in the editor. When this option is selected, AI Positron provides intelligent autocompletion based on the current file content and structure.

Specifies which AI model is used for generating autocompletion suggestions. Each model consumes a certain number of credits per token. If no other model is chosen, the gpt-4.1 model is used by default.
This table displays all the supported Oxygen editor types where AI Autocompletion can be activated. Use the checkboxes in this table to select which editors should have AI Autocompletion enabled.

dd.p:
A reference to a JSON file that configures MCP servers of three possible types:
Local process
HTTP Streamable
HTTP SSE

dlentry.dd: The configured timeout for attempts to connect to each server or retrieve content from it.

Selecting this option allows local MCP servers to run as external processes.Local MCP servers are run as processes from the current user account and have full access to the computer resources as all other processes run in the user account. Before enabling this option, you need to ensure that your configuration starts a secure MCP server and does not expose you to security risks.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: Enabled by default, this option allows all defined chat modes to access the tools provided by the MCP servers during conversations.

Presents the status of each MCP server connection and the tools that have been retrieved from it.All the tools loaded from an MCP server have their names prefixed with the name of the MCP server. This allows multiple servers to provide tools with the same name. If, for example, a tool name is search and is loaded from an MCP server named mcp-web-access, the tool name that needs to be referenced in a custom AI action is mcp-web-access_search.

dlentry.dt: Allow running the Oxygen XML application as a local MCP server (Experimental)
dlentry.dd: If enabled, external applications are allowed to programmatically start and control the Oxygen XML application. For more details, see .

section.title: Custom Options for the AI Positron Assistant
section.p: It is possible to configure certain options for the Oxygen AI Positron in the Oxygen XML application.
The following custom option is supported by adding the option in Oxygen's XML options file:

row.entry: Setting the value to true hides the Record examples for instructions button from appearing in the UI.

section.p:
The following option is supported by setting it as a system property:
Option name Value Description
allow.access.to.ai.positron.service boolean Setting the value to false hides the Oxygen AI Positron Service platform. This means that connecting to the service is not possible and all related settings and options are not available.
